channel.title: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?
channel.description:
As what I seen, (by moparscape 3.2 by looking at the .java files) I was going though the commands. Well, there was one part where it says "snowing = 1" or something like that (could of been snow1 = 1;)
But anyways, is there an actual way to make it snow? Or an effect (gfx?) to make it look like its snowing by command or just a location? If so, how?
~Dart Zamaki~

item.title: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?
item.dc:creator: @Dart_Zamaki Dart Zamaki
item.source: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?

item.title: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Declare this method:

public boolean snowArea() { if (absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####) { return true; } else { return false; } }

And in your process() add this:

if (snowArea()) { outStream.createFrame(208); outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(11877); } if (!snowArea()) { outStream.createFrame(0); outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(0); }

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?

item.title: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?
item.dc:creator: @Dart_Zamaki Dart Zamaki
item.description:
@Dart_Zamaki wrote:

WOW thx! (But how could I make it loop then?)

Read full topic

item.title: Is there anyway to make a place like its snowing?
item.dc:creator: @stormcutter stormcutter
item.description:
@stormcutter wrote:

Most servers have a ::snow command. Just do it and it will snow. If it doesn’t work, it’s very easy to add it.

Read full topic
